greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of -2*cos(5*Pi/7).
comment: rho_3 := +2*cos(5*Pi/7) is the negative zero of the minimal polynomial C(7, x) = x^3 - x^2 - 2*x + 1 of the algebraic number rho(7) = 2*cos(Pi/7), the length ratio of the smaller diagonal and the side in the regular 7-gon (heptagon). See A187360 and a link to the arXiv paper given there, eq. (20) for the zeros of C(n, x). The positive zeros are rho(7) and rho_2 = 2*cos(3*Pi/7) shown in A160389 and A255241.
Essentially the same as A231187 and A116425. - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 14 2015
formula: Solution of x^3 + x^2 - 2 x - 1 = 0; +1.246979603...  - _Clark Kimberling_, Jan 04 2020
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 13 2015
